creator: bweaver6
title: 74HC595 Shift Register Demystified
description: This project demonstrates the operation of the 74HC595 shift register, an 8-bit serial-in, serial or parallel-out shift register with output latches. The project visualizes the characteristics of the 595 and explains how to use it.
steps: Shift 8 bits into the register using the DS (Data Serial) input, with OE (Output Enable) in its true state (0). The data to be shifted is LSB 1 0 0 0 0 0 0 1 MSB.
After shifting in all 8 bits, set the STCP (Store Clock Pulse) to its true state (1) to latch the 8 bits.

Assemble the circuit, connecting the outputs (Q0-Q7S) to a logic analyzer (Logic Port). Use generated signal levels to operate the inputs: DS (Data Serial), MR’ (Master reset), OE’ (Output Enable), SHCP (Shift Clock Pulse) and STCP (Store Clock Pulse).
Set up the waveform generator with the following signal characteristics: SHCP - 500hz, DS - 1Khz, STCP - 1Khz, MR’ - 1Khz, OE’ - Constant Low(0).

Demonstrate the master reset function by observing the effect of the MR’ input on clearing the shift register. The STCP takes a snapshot of the register on each rising edge of the SHCP clock. When MR' input goes low, all outputs Q0-Q7 change to a low voltage state.
